review:
My husband and I had first visited doctor Suman in November 2019 when our home pregnancy test result was positive. We had searched for the best gynaecologist around and her name surfaced online with the highest rating and best reviews. Right from the first visit, we were very comfortable with doctor and although I had unfortunately suffered a sudden miscarriage, doctor comforted us explaining how somethings happen naturally and sometimes for our best. After my miscarriage, I did not get my periods naturally for 5 months inspite of all my reports being normal and it worried me big time. But doctor very calmly explained to me that there is nothing to worry and asked me to lose atleast 10 percent of my body weight. She said just try to lose 10 percent of your current weight and you will get your periods. That was exactly what happened when I lost weight as suggested and I could conceive naturally after 3 months. My pregnancy was when covid was at its peak, but it was really nice of doctor Suman to have online consultations with me and I had visited her at the clinic only on my 12th week after I conceived. My pregnancy journey was very smooth thanks to her care and she asked me to register at Rainbow hospital due to which I could avail benefits of attending online classes on Labour pain and delivery, epidural, Breastfeeding and such other topics which were very helpful. In my 32nd week, we realised that my AFI was at border around 10.6 units and having suffered a miscarriage once I was worried. It was very nice of dr. Suman to calm me down saying everything is fine and it instilled a lot of confidence in me. She had asked me to walk as much as possible for normal delivery. My due date was 22nd March,2021 but on 14th March early morning I experienced water leak and was rushed to Rainbow hospital. I was induced around 7.30am and Dr. Suman had spoken to me on call to explain me the procedure and also visited me in my room sometime later. She comforted me saying that my labour is proceeding very well, asked me to take deep breaths and be positive. My delivery although vaccum assisted was very smooth as doctor explained me when and how to push very nicely.She was very supportive and encouraging throughout and helped us deliver healthy baby boy and she also joked saying dekho baby ka weight acha hai all thanks to the aloo bhujia that you ate during pregnancy :) She even played my favourite Om Namah Shivaay song for me and my baby Rudransh in the labour room after delivery :). Although doctor is very strict and professional, she has a very caring and warm side to her, always patiently listening and answering all my questions. I have already recommended her to all my friends and cousins in Bangalore. Thank you Doctor Suman for making my journey to motherhood such a pleasant experience and wishing you happiness and roaring success always :)

- Your patient Vijayalakshmi Viswanathan

review:
I waited for 9 months to share my feedback regarding my pregnancy journey with Dr. Suman Singh. 

We are blessed with a baby boy on 27th March and we are overjoyed and extremely happy. It was a wonderful journey with Dr. Suman Singh which is really unforgettable.

She is extremely helpful, confident, graceful, attractive, down to earth, always listen to your problems carefully, give ample time to treat me and the main thing is she makes you so comfortable that you will just love her accompany. Dr., always gives us courage, a highly motivated person with great physical and mental strength and half of the problems get cured by seeing her. 

Let‚Äôs discuss my pregnancy journey with Dr. Suman Singh -  

During the initial scan, the impression of PCOD (polycystic ovary syndrome) and Low Lying Placenta was observed. We were in a lot of tensions. Dr never gave 0.1% tension to us, instead she says ‚Äúkuch nehi huya saab thik hai‚Äù. She prescribed few medicines and polycystic ovary got cured in 1st trimester only and told Low Lying Placenta 90% patients get cured in later stages of pregnancy. 

From 1st week to last day till delivery, I used to vomit a lot. During these days, I used to visit Dr. Suman Singh twice a week. She always used to listen very patiently and prescribed medicine with multiple choices. Dr always treats us with a smiling face. By seeing her all my worries and pain vanish suddenly. We get positive energy once we meet Dr. and she always gave priority to my feeling and thoughts. During my 28 weeks, scan shown AFI level was gone low 7.8 mm. When we showed scan reports to Dr, she told to drink enough water regularly, prescribed a few medicines and my next scan after 7 days the AFI level was 10.5mm.  This is all possible because Dr. helped us to think positive towards any hurdles and worries during my pregnancy. 

I was suffering from severe vomiting, frequent motion and upper abdominal pain on 14th March. Dr. Suman Singh was out of the station on that day but still, she was in touch and connected with me.  Dr said to get admit in Rainbow and she had taken care of my treatment at the hospital. From 26th March morning onwards I was suffering from severe lower and upper abdomen pain and was not able to bear it. So I called Dr. Suman Singh at night 10 PM, she picked my call and told me to get admitted to Rainbow hospital. It was a late night so thought let‚Äôs bear the pain tonight will go to the Dr. clinic on 27th March and will show her at the clinic. 

27th March - We visited Dr. Suman Singh clinic at 6.30 PM, she asked me Why you had not admitted to the hospital yesterday? Dr. told she could not sleep properly whole night as she was in believing that she can get a call from the hospital any time at night. After Dr examined me and told your labor pain had started, get admitted to hospital now will do Caesarean section delivery. We took a lot of tensions and asked Dr. What we have to say at the hospital? Dr told us with a smiling face, don‚Äôt take any tension, go to the hospital rest I will take care of everything. The reply from Dr. given us a lot of strength and mental support to us. 

I got admitted to hospital at 7.30 PM, completed pre-joining formalities and nurses prepared me for Operating theater. Dr. Suman Singh reached hospital between 8.30 to 9 PM. By 9.30 PM, I heard my baby crying‚Ä¶. When nurses showed my baby, my eyes were filled with tears. It‚Äôs the best feeling ever had in my life and it was all possible only because of Dr. While Dr was leaving from OT, I told ‚ÄúThank you‚Äù and asked everything is fine right? Dr. blessed me by keeping her hand in my forehead and told: ‚Äúsaab thik hai, kuch tension nehi hai‚Äù. 

My expected date of delivery was 8th April. I am very afraid of normal delivery. Dr. Suman Singh requested many times to me for normal delivery and explained me consequences of Caesarean section delivery, but I requested for planned C-section delivery on 29th March by consulting with the doctor. 

Dr. Suman Singh has a very strong personality and salutes to her stamina. She is a great motivator and a very nice human being. Word‚Äôs are not enough to express my feelings. Thank you very very much and I will very grateful to you. You made our life complete. I would strongly recommend Dr. Suman Singh.

reply_text: After deducting taxes and consumables what I get is actually only Rs 400 for seeing the patient twice, taking the history, examining, making the differential diagnosis, ordering the relevant tests, interpreting the reports, prescribing the relevant medicines and clearing all the doubts. For subsequent visits the tests are written in advance so 90% of patients don't need 2 visits.Doctors work for long hours beyond the norms set by labour laws yet we never get paid overtime!! Think about it with a reasonable mind... the amount is actually very less compared to our contemporaries in other professions.We also don't have any of the perks that other professions enjoy like gratuity,retirement benefits,paid holidays ,stock options ,bonus etc. Most doctors feel exploited ,overworked and underpaid! There is a lot of burn out in the medical fraternity,doctors die 10 years  before the average human due to all this stress  yet patients are only happy to find fault with them.Honestly after almost 25 years of practice, spending the best years of our lives with books and in hospitals, to have a 20 something patient who doesn't even get her spellings right ,question our  fees /seniority and clinical acumen is insulting to say the least.
